meanings.definition: A person who speaks only one language.
meanings.sent1: Monolinguals can communicate effectively in their native language.
meanings.sent2: Many monolinguals find it challenging to learn a second language.
meanings.sent3: The monolinguals at the conference were amazed by the multilingual presentations.
meanings.sent4: In a world of diverse languages, monolinguals are like solitary islands.
meanings.sent5: The group consisted mostly of monolinguals, making language barriers a common issue.

meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of monolinguals.
meanings.sent1: The monolinguals community organized language exchange events.
meanings.sent2: Her monolinguals background limited her job opportunities abroad.
meanings.sent3: The monolinguals party was a fun mix of different cultures.
meanings.sent4: In a globalized world, being monolinguals can sometimes feel isolating.
meanings.sent5: The monolinguals curriculum focused on improving language skills through immersion.
